00012 #ifndef BOOST_ASSIGN_V2_RANGE_CHAIN_AUX_BITWISE_OR_ER_2010_HPP
00013 #define BOOST_ASSIGN_V2_RANGE_CHAIN_AUX_BITWISE_OR_ER_2010_HPP
00014 #include <boost/mpl/void.hpp>
00015 #include <boost/assign/v2/chain/traits/result.hpp>
00016 #include <boost/assign/v2/chain/aux_/adaptor.hpp>
00017 #include <boost/assign/v2/chain/aux_/sub.hpp>
00018 
00019 // Design:
00020 // - The original design is boost::chain in RangeEx
00021 // - ER modified as follows:
00022 //      - sets the underlying iterator's Reference to one which both inputs are
00023 //      convertible to.
00024 //      - Constness is determined by that of the elements in each range, not that
00025 //  of the range.
00026 // - Finally, MPG proposed a way to compose chains http://gist.github.com/287791
00027 // and a variant of it is used below.
00028 
00029 namespace boost{
00030 namespace assign{
00031 namespace v2{
00032 namespace adaptor{
00033 namespace{
00034         const chain_aux::adaptor2<> _chain = chain_aux::adaptor2<>();
00035 }
00036 }// adaptor
00037 namespace result_of{
00038 
00039     template<typename R1, typename R2, typename Tag = use_default>
00040     struct chain : chain_aux::result<R1, R2, Tag>{};
00041 
00042 }// result_of
00043 namespace chain_aux{
00044 
00045 #define BOOST_ASSIGN_V2_FRAMEWORK_CHAIN(U1) \
00046     template<typename R1,typename U2,typename Tag> \
00047     typename chain_aux::result<U1, U2, Tag>::type \
00048     operator|(U1 & r1, chain_aux::adaptor1<U2, Tag> const & h) \
00049     { \
00050         typedef chain_aux::result<U1, U2, Tag> caller_; \
00051         return chain_aux::make_sub( caller_::call( r1, h.value ) ); \
00052     } \
00053 \
00054 
00055 
00056 BOOST_ASSIGN_V2_FRAMEWORK_CHAIN(R1      )
00057 BOOST_ASSIGN_V2_FRAMEWORK_CHAIN(R1 const)
00058 #undef BOOST_ASSIGN_V2_FRAMEWORK_CHAIN
00059 
00060 }// chain_aux
00061 
00062 //#define BOOST_ASSIGN_V2_FRAMEWORK_CHAIN(U1, U2) \
00063 //    template<typename Tag,typename R1,typename R2> \
00064 //    typename chain_aux::result<U1, U2, Tag>::type \
00065 //    chain(U1 & r1, U2 & r2) \
00066 //    { \
00067 //        return r1 | adaptor::_chain( r2 ); \
00068 //    } \
00069 //\
00070 
00071 
00072 //BOOST_ASSIGN_V2_FRAMEWORK_CHAIN(R1      , R2        )
00073 //BOOST_ASSIGN_V2_FRAMEWORK_CHAIN(R1      , R2 const  )
00074 //BOOST_ASSIGN_V2_FRAMEWORK_CHAIN(R1 const, R2        )
00075 //BOOST_ASSIGN_V2_FRAMEWORK_CHAIN(R1 const, R2 const  )
00076 //#undef BOOST_ASSIGN_V2_FRAMEWORK_CHAIN
00077 
00078 }// v2
00079 }// assign
00080 }// boost
00081 
00082 #endif
